title: Type Design
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217233946/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217233946/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Type Design**

The craft of devising new versions of [alphabet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217233946/http:/typophile.com/wiki/alphabet)s for use in a [font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217233946/http:/typophile.com/wiki/font).

Type designers are sometimes mistakenly called fontographers. [Fontographer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217233946/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Fontographer) was the name of a popular computer program for designing type, predominantly used during the 1990s and early 2000s.

**Relationship to typography.**

[Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217233946/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typography) is the craft of using pre-made [alphabets](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217233946/http:/typophile.com/wiki/alphabets) in designs, type design is the art of crafting new alphabets. Quite often one person occupies both roles, and specializes to a greater or lesser degree in one or the other.

See also [How-To](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217233946/http:/typophile.com/wiki/How-To)
author: paul d hunt
